comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Hayes_(unionist) Frank J. Hayes (1882 - June 10, 1948) was a miner and president of the United Mine Workers of America (UMWA) from 1917 to 1920. In late 1914, Hayes was vice-president and Doyle was secretary-treasurer of District 15 of the United Mine Workers of America. See, for example, books.google.com/books?id=x-geAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA6936

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Jan 29, 1915 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B04E2DA1538E633A... indicates that these three were in town to give testimony to the "Walsh Commission" on Industrial Relations. They also met with John D. Rockefeller Jr. Frank J. Hayes, Edward L. Doyle, and James Lord. Lord was head of the mining department of the American Federation of Labor.

comment.author: 46484616@N04
comment._content: Lovely Candid Shots of Powerful Men in 1900s

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Swanq, I didn't see that the article said they were in town to testify before the Walsh Commission. Hayes and Doyle testified the prior month in Denver, and were probably there to see the continued hearings on the Colorado mine labor problems and to see J.D. Rockefeller, Jr. and others testify about Colorado, starting on January 25, 1915. I don't think Lord ever testified. Testimony is online at: www.archive.org/stream/industrialrelati08unitrich This seems to be taken in front of the same steps as the Bain shot of Mother Jones, presumably the front of City Hall.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: A biographical sketch of James Revell Lord (1878-1948), miner and union official, appears as an annotation to a volume of Eugene V. Debs' letters: books.google.com/books?id=fl7VQD4ZZcoC&lpg=PA153&...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: @artolog:  I'm sure you are correct.  I had read another article (not sure where now) where Rockefeller indicated that he planned to take advantage of their presence to talk to them.  I probably simply assumed they also gave testimony on this trip.
